SEARCH
Package edu.wit.scds.ds.list.app

Class Card

java.lang.Object
edu.wit.scds.ds.list.app.Card
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Card>
public class Card extends Object implements Comparable<Card>
Representation of a playing card with a suit and rank.

The suit and rank are immutable.

Version:
1.0.0 2020-11-19 initial version
, 2.0.0 2021-12-08
  • add support for face up/down
  • add matches()

, 2.1.0 2022-11-06 support dynamic switching to compare cards based on suit and rank or rank alone
, 2.2.0 2024-03-26
  • minor cosmetic changes
  • revise toString() for greater formatting flexibility and control

, 2.3.0 2024-03-26 Modifications for use for our game
Author:
Dave Rosenberg, Your Name // TODO

    • Card

      public Card(Suit theSuit, Rank theRank, boolean initiallyFaceUp)
      Initializes a card with a specified suit rank, and face up setting
      Parameters:
      theSuit - this card's suit
      theRank - this card's rank
      initiallyFaceUp - if true, the card is face up; if false, the card is face down

  • Method Details

    • flip

      public boolean flip()
      Flips a card over
      Returns:
      the previous state (face up/down)

    • hide

      public boolean hide()
      Turns a card face down
      Returns:
      the previous state (face up/down)

    • reveal

      public boolean reveal()
      Turns a card face up
      Returns:
      the previous state (face up/down)

    • getCompareSuit

      public static boolean getCompareSuit()
      Retrieves the current behavior of equals() and compareTo() wrt this.suit
      Returns:
      true if equals() and compareTo() include this.suit; false otherwise

    • setCompareSuit

      public static boolean setCompareSuit(boolean newCompareRankSuit)
      Sets the behavior of equals() and compareTo() wrt this.suit
      Parameters:
      newCompareRankSuit - the new evaluation behavior wrt this.suit where true causes equals() and compareTo() to include this.suit in their evaluations; false won't consider it
      Returns:
      the previous state (consider/ignore)

    • getFaceUp

      public boolean getFaceUp()
      Retrieves whether a card is face up or down
      Returns:
      the card's state (face up/down)

    • setFaceUp

      public boolean setFaceUp(boolean newFaceUp)
      Sets a card to be face up/down
      Parameters:
      newFaceUp - the new face up/down state, where true indicates face up, false is face down
      Returns:
      the previous state (face up/down)

    • getFaceDownText

      public static String getFaceDownText()
      Retrieves the text to display when the card is face down
      Returns:
      the text to display when the card is face down - null indicates to use the default

    • setFaceDownText

      public static String setFaceDownText(String newFaceDownText)
      Sets the text to display when the card is face down
      Parameters:
      newFaceDownText - the new text to display when the card is face down
      Returns:
      the previous text to display when the card is face down

    • getDefaultFaceUp

      public static boolean getDefaultFaceUp()
      Retrieves the default for new cards to be face up/down
      Returns:
      the current default state (face up/down)

    • setDefaultFaceUp

      public static boolean setDefaultFaceUp(boolean newFaceUp)
      Sets the default for new cards to be face up/down

      Note that this will only be effective for cards instantiated

      Parameters:
      newFaceUp - the new face up/down state, where true indicates face up, false is face down
      Returns:
      the previous state (face up/down)

    • matches

      public boolean matches(Card otherCard)
      Compares two cards to see if they match, which may be different from them being equal()

      The game or Pile class may require this method to behave differently from equals() or compreTo().

      Parameters:
      otherCard - the card to compare against this card
      Returns:
      true if the cards match, false otherwise
